source.title: Fossils reveal dinosaurs were thriving in North America just before being wiped out by asteroid strike, study shows - CBS News
source.name: CBS News

facts: Scientists have long debated the decline of dinosaurs before an asteroid impact.
The Earth was struck by a massive asteroid about 66 million years ago.
This event caused mass extinction, wiping out many species including dinosaurs.
Fossils from New Mexico suggest that dinosaurs were thriving just before the strike.

neutral.headline: New Study Suggests Dinosaurs Were Thriving Before Asteroid Impact
neutral.body_html: A new study based on fossils from New Mexico indicates that dinosaurs were flourishing in North America just before a catastrophic asteroid strike 66 million years ago, which led to their mass extinction.

conservative.headline: Study Finds Dinosaurs Were Thriving Before Asteroid Impact
conservative.body_html: A recent study using fossils from New Mexico shows that dinosaurs were thriving in North America just before a massive asteroid impact 66 million years ago, which led to their mass extinction.

liberal.headline: New Evidence Shows Dinosaurs Were Thriving Before Asteroid Impact
liberal.body_html: A groundbreaking study based on fossils from New Mexico reveals that dinosaurs were not only surviving but thriving in North America just before a catastrophic asteroid impact 66 million years ago, which led to their mass extinction. This new evidence challenges the long-held belief of declining dinosaur populations prior to this event and sheds light on how these magnificent creatures lived.
